lead_paragraph: Professional soccer will return to Silicon Valley for the 2008 season with the approval of the San Jose Earthquakes as an expansion team, Don Garber, the commissioner of Major League Soccer, said.The Earthquakes still need approval from the San Jose City Council for plans to build a privately financed stadium that would seat 20,000 and open in 2010.The Earthquakes won two M.L.S. Cup titles before moving to Houston in 2005 after plans for financing a stadium in San Jose failed. The Houston team, now known as the Dynamo, won the M.L.S. Cup title last year.
